title: Ship Systems, Not Just Features
summary: My playbook for moving faster without losing creative control: design operating systems that turn good ideas into repeatable wins.
contentHtml:
The fastest teams I work with have one thing in common: they build systems before they obsess over fireworks. Systems look boring on day one but compound into unfair advantages.

A system for everything

1. Signals - what questions matter now? 2. Inputs - which users unlock momentum? 3. Loops - how do we feed learning back into the roadmap?

When every launch connects back to those three loops, ship velocity no longer depends on heroics.

The automation layer

Automation is the connective tissue. In my personal stack:

``text Linear -> Notion -> GitHub -> Website -> LinkedIn ``

A small Node script ingests Markdown, populates the blog JSON, and hits the LinkedIn UGC API. One command, two distribution channels.

Action items

  • Write a short memo titled "How we decide what to build".
  • Automate one distribution workflow this week.
  • Review the system monthly. Prune aggressively.

The point is not to automate empathy. It is to free up more cycles for it.

title: Building With AI Co-pilots Without Losing Taste
summary: Thoughts on pairing with AI tools to speed up delivery while keeping a sharp point of view.
contentHtml:
I keep hearing that AI strips away the soul of craft. It only does that when you abdicate intent. Treat the models as collaborators with sharp guardrails:

  • Drafting: Let the copilot outline, then rewrite the hook yourself.
  • Refactoring: Ask for edge-case hunts, but keep domain logic in your head.
  • Distribution: Use AI to repurpose snippets, not to invent what you never said.

    • These simple constraints help me keep a consistent voice while shipping more.

    Tools I lean on

  • Cursor for exploratory coding sprints.
  • V0 for wireframes when time-boxed to 20 minutes.
  • My own prompt library stored beside the codebase, versioned just like any other artifact.

Taste is a backlog item. Automate everything else so you can invest more in it.
